page.title: 17DUNHOLME SPRING AND SCHOOL.
page.content:
DUNHOLME SPRING. The Spring located near the Beck and the Church was bored in 1892 on orders of the Sanitary Authorities as the people of Dunholme were drinking polluted water and many were dying of Diptheria. The Spring is 100 ft deep and it was restored in 1964. The event was featured on radio and B.B.C. television.
DUNHOLME PRIMARY SCHOOL. Dunholme primary school children moved into new school buildings on the Ryland Rd. in 1984. The old building opposite the Church was originally built as a Church School in 1861.It is hoped that the old school buildings will be made into Parish meeting rooms. Mr J. Jeffreys Headmaster of the Primary school for 25 years retired in July 1985. .
